wcGeneSummary 0.99.0
  • Reference

    wcGeneSummary

    compareWordNet

    compareWordNet.Rd

    compare two gene clusters based on words

    Usage

    compareWordNet(
  listOfNets,
  titles = NULL,
  layout = "nicely",
  hull = FALSE,
  size = 4,
  conc = 1,
  tag = FALSE,
  tagLevel = 1,
  edgeLink = TRUE,
  freq = TRUE,
  freqMean = FALSE,
  scaleRange = c(5, 10)
)

    Arguments

    listOfNets

    list consisting results of wc* functions (plotType="network")

    titles

    title to be shown on plot

    layout

    layout

    hull

    show category by hull

    size

    node size

    conc

    concavity parameter

    tag

    show tag on plot

    tagLevel

    words that tagged in this many networks will be included

    edgeLink

    whether to use link or diagonal

    freq

    concatenate frequency and show it on plot

    freqMean

    how to concatenate frequency (TRUE: mean, FALSE: sum)

    scaleRange

    point size scaling

    Value

    plot comparing gene clusters

    Examples

    wc1 <- wcGeneSummary("DDX41", plotType="network")
#> Input genes: 1
#> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns
#> Converted input genes: 1
#> filtered 61 words (frequency | tfidf) ...
#> Error in cor(freqWordsDTM[, colnames(freqWordsDTM) %in% freqWords]): supply both 'x' and 'y' or a matrix-like 'x'
wc2 <- wcGeneSummary("IRF3", plotType="network")
#> Input genes: 1
#> 'select()' returned 1:1 mapping between keys and columns
#> Converted input genes: 1
#> filtered 61 words (frequency | tfidf) ...
#> Error in cor(freqWordsDTM[, colnames(freqWordsDTM) %in% freqWords]): supply both 'x' and 'y' or a matrix-like 'x'
compare <- compareWordNet(list(wc1, wc2))
#> Error in compareWordNet(list(wc1, wc2)): object 'wc1' not found
